main event: An observer reported seeing a disc-shaped yellowish, glowing object in Morgantown, West Virginia on March 15, 1949, which emitted a long, yellowish, tapering trail of flame.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be 18 inches in diameter and was observed from a distance of 20 miles.,The sighting lasted for two or three seconds and followed a northeast to southwest trajectory.,The observer reported seeing another similar object on March 28, 1949.,Weather conditions were checked, providing details on visibility and cloud cover at the time of the sighting.,Records from the Morgantown Police Department yielded no related reports.
witness description: The observer was from Morgantown, West Virginia, engaged in real estate.
